docs.lead_paragraph: For the president and his campaign, the challenge is to overcome a decline in voter enthusiasm from 2008.

headline.main: Obama’s Stump Speech Boils Down to One Word
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Stump Speech Boils Down to One Word

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, with 19 days left before the election, has distilled his stump speech down to a simple but urgent appeal for voters to get to the polls; Obama faces a significant challenge in overcoming a decline in voter enthusiasm from his 2008 campaign, problem that has only grown worse following a lackluster performance in the first debate.
docs.snippet: For the president and his campaign, the challenge is to overcome a decline in voter enthusiasm from 2008.

headline.main: Shrink Inequality to Grow the Economy?

docs.abstract: Once we thought a rising tide would lift all boats. Now some economists think a few boats need a push, before the economy can really expand.
docs.snippet: Once we thought a rising tide would lift all boats. Now some economists think a few boats need a push, before the economy can really expand.

headline.main: At a Dinner, Political Banter and Some Familiar Suspicions

docs.abstract: The Day: The Alfred E. Smith Memorial Foundation Dinner, being held Thursday night, has been a setting for political leaders who eye one another suspiciously and disagree strongly.
docs.snippet: The Day: The Alfred E. Smith Memorial Foundation Dinner, being held Thursday night, has been a setting for political leaders who eye one another suspiciously and disagree strongly.

headline.main: Jon Stewart Proposes an Entrepreneurial Policy. Don't Laugh.

docs.abstract: The Comedy Central host is proposing that rather than cut taxes to amplify the rewards of success, we should find ways to ease the damage done by failure.
docs.snippet: The Comedy Central host is proposing that rather than cut taxes to amplify the rewards of success, we should find ways to ease the damage done by failure.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: With Election Day looming, the push for votes is coming down not only to a state-by-state fight, but also to one for the allegiance of vital demographic groups, chief among them undecided women.

headline.seo: Campaigns Raise Focus on Women for Final Weeks
headline.main: Rival Campaigns Intently Pursue Votes of Women
headline.print_headline: Rival Campaigns Intently Pursue Votes of Women

docs.abstract: Campaigns of Pres Obama and Mitt Romney are turning attention to wooing undecided women voters; development underscores how, with Election Day looming, push for votes is coming down not only to state-by-state fight, but also to one for allegiance of vital demographic groups; Romney's campaign is making concerted effort to cut into Pres Obama's sizable lead among women.
docs.snippet: With Election Day looming, the push for votes is coming down not only to a state-by-state fight, but also to one for the allegiance of vital demographic groups, chief among them undecided women.

byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Mark Landler contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEREMY W. PETERS

docs.lead_paragraph: One constant in a struggling city like Elyria, Ohio, is the shared determination to make it through this day and into the next.

headline.seo: This Land: With a New Menu and a Makeover, a Pledge to Keep Going
headline.main: With a New Menu and a Makeover, a Promise to Keep Going
headline.print_headline: With a New Menu and a Makeover, a Promise to Keep Going

docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column observes that one constant in struggling cities like Elyria, Ohio, is shared determination to make it through one day and onto the next; sentiment is evinced by Donna Dove, owner of Donna's Diner, who is reinventing her menu in anticipation of better times to come. (Series: Donna's Diner)
docs.snippet: One constant in a struggling city like Elyria, Ohio, is the shared determination to make it through this day and into the next.

docs.lead_paragraph: The experience of a college friend who lacked health insurance has lessons for us and our country.
docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column expresses shock at some readers' unsympathetic responses to his October 14 column on his friend suffering from prostate cancer and need for universal healthcare; reveals that his friend has died, and his experience offers several lessons about how health care reform law can help others who find themselves in similar situations.
docs.snippet: The experience of a college friend who lacked health insurance has lessons for us and our country.

docs.lead_paragraph: The women of America enjoy a good pander as much as anybody else, but could we cut down on the shouting and barking?

headline.seo: Women and the Men Who Yell
headline.main: Women and the Men Who Yell
headline.print_headline: Women And the Men Who Yell

docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column reflects on way in which women voters may have reacted to squabbling in second presidential debate.
docs.snippet: The women of America enjoy a good pander as much as anybody else, but could we cut down on the shouting and barking?

docs.lead_paragraph: During the debate, Romney bumbled his way through a cringe-inducing attempt to graft what he thinks should be 2012 talking points onto his 1952 sensibility.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney’s Version of Equal Rights
headline.main: Mr. Romney’s Version of Equal Rights
headline.print_headline: Mr. Romney’s Version of Equal Rights

docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes Mitt Romney for making misleading statements about his stance on contraceptives during second presidential debate; dismantles his nonsensical answer on issue of equal pay for women.
docs.snippet: During the debate, Romney bumbled his way through a cringe-inducing attempt to graft what he thinks should be 2012 talking points onto his 1952 sensibility.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney girded for a final debate on Monday and the increasingly pugilistic closing rounds of the election.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Keep Up Attacks After Debate
headline.main: Obama and Romney Keep Up Attacks After Debate
headline.print_headline: Obama and Romney Keep Up Attacks After Debate

docs.abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney return to the campaign trail following their contentious second debate; both candidates continue to attack each other aggressively as they prepare for the final debate and the closing rounds of the election.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney girded for a final debate on Monday and the increasingly pugilistic closing rounds of the election.
